label: 高抜地
説明文: Takanuki-chi (unassessed land") refers to land whose title has been transferred, either by a lender's repossession of land used as loan collateral, or by sale at a higher than customary price, in which the original landholder continues to be responsible for payment of some portion of the land tax on the land he formerly held.#[article]Moriya Maroto. The Morphology of Takanuki-chi and Land-Transfer Contracts in the Mid- to Late-Edo period: Examples from Murayama District, Dewa Province."
